summary.para: Include the specified pointer in the set of pointers processed by the Interaction Context object.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Handle to the Interaction Context object.

param.name: pointerId
param.para: ID of the pointer.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Turn pointer filtering on by setting INTERACTION_CONTEXT_PROPERTY_FILTER_POINTERS in SetPropertyInteractionContext.

summary.para: Adds the history for a single input pointer to the buffer of the Interaction Context object.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: The handle of the interaction context.

param.name: entriesCount
param.para: The number of entries in the pointer history.

param.name: pointerInfo
param.para: Basic pointer information common to all pointer types.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Creates and initializes an Interaction Context object.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: DestroyInteractionContext must be called to destroy any interaction context created by CreateInteractionContext.

summary.para: Destroys the specified Interaction Context object.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: The handle of the interaction context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: DestroyInteractionContext must be called to destroy any interaction context created by CreateInteractionContext.

summary.para: Gets the cross-slide interaction behavior.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: The handle of the interaction context.

param.name: threshold
param.para: One of the constants from CROSS_SLIDE_THRESHOLD.

param.name: distance
param.para: The distance threshold of threshold.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the inertia behavior of a manipulation (translation, rotation, scaling).

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: The handle of the interaction context.

param.name: inertiaParameter
param.para: One of the constants from INERTIA_PARAMETER.

param.name: value
param.para: The value of inertiaParameter. This value is one of the following:

item.description: The rate of deceleration, in radians/ms².
For translation, the relative change in screen location, in HIMETRIC units.
For rotation, the relative change in angle of rotation, in radians
For scaling, the relative change in size, in HIMETRIC units.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets interaction configuration state for the Interaction Context object.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

param.name: configurationCount
param.para: Number of interaction configurations.

param.name: configuration
param.para: The interactions enabled for this Interaction Context object.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the mouse wheel state for the Interaction Context object.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

param.name: value
param.para: The value of parameter.

param.name: parameter
param.para: One of the constants from MOUSE_WHEEL_PARAMETER.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets Interaction Context object properties.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Handle to the Interaction Context object.

param.name: contextProperty
param.para: One of the constants identified by INTERACTION_CONTEXT_PROPERTY.

param.name: value
param.para: The value of the property.
Valid values for contextProperty are:

description.para: Measurement units are HIMETRIC units (0.01 mm).
Measurement units are screen pixels. This is the default value.
Visual feedback for user interactions is disabled (the caller is responsible for displaying visual feedback). For more info, see Input Feedback Configuration.
Visual feedback for user interactions is enabled. This is the default value. For more info, see Input Feedback Configuration.
Pointer filtering is disabled (all pointer input data is processed).
Pointer filtering is enabled (only pointers specified through AddPointerInteractionContext are processed). This is the default value.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets current Interaction Context state and the time when the context will return to idle state.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

param.name: pointerInfo
param.para: Basic pointer information common to all pointer types.

param.name: state
param.para: One of the constants from INTERACTION_STATE.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: After interaction ends, the interaction context might still be busy reporting inertia, or expecting second tap in a double tap gesture (in general, if multi-stroke gesture is possible). This function allows the caller to find out when it is safe to treat the Interaction Context object as idle. The main purpose of this function is management of pools of interaction contexts.

summary.para: Process buffered packets at the end of a pointer input frame.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: ProcessBufferedPacketsInteractionContext is called at the end of the frame, when the buffer contains all the pointer histories from the frame.

summary.para: Sends timer input to the Interaction Context object for inertia processing.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The caller is responsible for creating timer when inertia starts, and for driving inertia input with the timer by calling this function from the timer callback. Recommended timer period is 15 ms.
This function has no effect outside inertia.

summary.para: Processes a set of pointer input frames.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

param.name: entriesCount
param.para: Number of frames to process.

param.name: pointerCount
param.para: Number of pointers in each frame.

param.name: pointerInfo
param.para: Pointer to the array of frames (of size entriesCount).

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Output notifications are sent as required.
Frames must be processed in reverse chronological order (most recent data first).
Each frame must have the same set of input pointers.
Each pointer must originate from a different contact.

If pointer filtering is set, a sub-frame that includes the specified pointers is extracted from each frame. Pointers are specified through AddPointerInteractionContext and pointer filtering turned on by setting INTERACTION_CONTEXT_PROPERTY_FILTER_POINTERS in SetPropertyInteractionContext.

summary.para: Registers a callback to receive interaction events from an Interaction Context object.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Handle to the Interaction Context.

param.name: outputCallback
param.para: The callback function.

param.name: clientData
param.para: A pointer to an object that contains information about the client. The value typically points to the object for which the member function is called (this).

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Each instance of an Interaction Context is limited to one output callback. Registering a callback function overwrites any existing callback registration for the Interaction Context.
This function is typically called after the creation of an Interaction Context or when the Interaction Context is reassigned to another UI element.

summary.para: Remove the specified pointer from the set of pointers processed by the Interaction Context object.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Handle to the Interaction Context object.

param.name: pointerId
param.para: ID of the pointer.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Resets the interaction state, interaction configuration settings, and all parameters to their initial state. Current interactions are cancelled without notifications. Interaction Context must be reconfigured before next use.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Useful for managing a pool of Interaction Context objects.
Current interactions are cancelled without notifications.

summary.para: Configures the cross-slide interaction.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: The handle of the interaction context.

param.name: parameterCount
param.para: Number of parameters to set.

param.name: crossSlideParameters
param.para: The cross-slide threshold and its distance threshold.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: SetCrossSlideParametersInteractionContext fails if a CROSS_SLIDE_PARAMETER is enabled, but not specified in the crossSlideParameters parameter.
This example demonstrates how to set custom cross-slide thresholds.

summary.para: Configures the inertia behavior of a manipulation (translation, rotation, scaling) after the contact is lifted.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: The handle of the interaction context.

param.name: inertiaParameter
param.para: One of the constants from INERTIA_PARAMETER.

param.name: value
param.para: One of the following:

item.description: The rate of deceleration, in radians/ms².
For translation, the relative change in screen location, in HIMETRIC units.
For rotation, the relative change in angle of rotation, in radianx
For scaling, the relative change in size, in HIMETRIC units.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Interaction Context uses the inertia system setting for all manipulations (translation, rotation, scaling). This function overrides the system setting.
To restore the system setting, set value to INERTIA_PARAMETER_INVALID_VALUE FLT_MAX.

summary.para: Configures the Interaction Context object to process the specified manipulations.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: The handle of the Interaction Context.

param.name: configurationCount
param.para: The number of interactions being configured.

param.name: configuration
param.para: The interactions to enable for this Interaction Context object.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: By default, no configuration flags are set (no interactions are enabled). Each interaction must be explicitly declared.
Configuration changes are applied only to new interactions.

summary.para: Sets the parameter values for mouse wheel input.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

param.name: value
param.para: The value for parameter.

param.name: parameter
param.para: One of the constants identified by MOUSE_WHEEL_PARAMETER.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the center point, and the pivot radius from the center point, for a rotation manipulation using a single input pointer.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

param.name: x
param.para: The x-coordinate for the screen location of the center point.

param.name: y
param.para: The y-coordinate for the screen location of the center point.

param.name: radius
param.para: The offset between the center point and the single input pointer, in HIMETRIC units.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets Interaction Context object properties.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Handle to the Interaction Context object.

param.name: contextProperty
param.para: One of the constants identified by INTERACTION_CONTEXT_PROPERTY.

param.name: value
param.para: The value of the constant identified by contextProperty.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the interaction state to INTERACTION_STATE_IDLE and leaves all interaction configuration settings and parameters intact. Current interactions are cancelled and notifications sent as required. Interaction Context does not have to be reconfigured before next use.

param.name: interactionContext
param.para: Handle to the Interaction Context object.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
